page.title: 12BAWDLANDS DISASTER CLITHEROE
page.content: The residents of Bawdlands had alway been worried of a vehicle going out of control and landing 10 feet on their street. One day that happened. It was May 31st 1985. A trailer with three heifers was coming back from the Auction Mart. Just when it had turned the bend on Railway Bridge the coupling snapped and the trailer knocked down tons of masonary. This also brought down fifty yards of iron railings, these landing only yards from the terraced houses. Fortunately no one was killed and the cows were only shocked, apart from one which had a broken horn. As there was a danger to pedestrians wooden railings were put up by the County Councils Highway Department although it is the responsibility of British Rail.
